p: A range of five concentrations was used in triplicate to obtain a regression equation and to assess the response linearity (R 2), limits of detection (LOD), and limits of quantification (LOQ). Linearity was evaluated by determining the R 2 value of the equation derived from the peaks for the serially diluted five concentrations. The results showed that the LOD and LOQ were acceptably low ( Table 1). The LC-MS analysis of the MeOH extracts from the two P. multiflorum types indicated that the quantitative levels of the TSG in the samples were 53.59 µg/mL for CS-derived plants and 50.75 µg/mL for SS-derived plants. The TSG levels were relatively higher in the CS-derived plants than in the SS-derived plants ( Figure 4D).
